overview_summary: All five adjacent landowners have no publicly documented stance on development or clean energy – none have made clear statements of support or opposition. Most lack formal community roles; only one (Tillapaugh) is part of a prominent multi-generation farm family, indicating some community influence, while the rest appear to have low public profiles.

neighbors.name: Joseph Zeh
neighbors.claims: No substantial information on Joseph Zeh was found in public records or local media, suggesting he keeps a very low profile ([www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov](https://www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov/EdocWebApp/faces/VillCob/index.xhtml#:~:text=No%20,zeh)). He has not appeared in recent town or county meeting minutes, indicating no active public role ([www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov](https://www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov/EdocWebApp/faces/VillCob/index.xhtml#:~:text=No%20,zeh)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach quietly through a trusted local acquaintance to build rapport, given his low-profile and private nature.

neighbors.name: Jose Pimentel
neighbors.claims: No references to Jose Pimentel were identified in available Schoharie County records or news sources ([www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov](https://www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov/EdocWebApp/faces/VillCob/index.xhtml#:~:text=No%20,pimentel)). Aside from being listed as a Cobleskill landowner, he has no documented civic roles or public statements ([www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov](https://www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov/EdocWebApp/faces/VillCob/index.xhtml#:~:text=No%20,pimentel)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Begin with a personal, one-on-one introduction to establish rapport and learn his concerns since he isn’t publicly engaged.

neighbors.name: Gerald J. Toscano
neighbors.claims: Gerald J. Toscano, now in his early 60s, relocated from New Jersey and began listing a Cobleskill address (Little York Road) around 2012 ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/gerald-toscano#:~:text=Gerald%20J%20Toscano%20is%20sixty,1348)) ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/gerald-toscano#:~:text=39%20Mayer%20Dr%2C%20Clifton%2C%20NJ%2C,current%20address)). He has only recently become a full-time resident, and his name does not appear in local government records, indicating no notable community involvement to date ([www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov](https://www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov/EdocWebApp/faces/VillCob/index.xhtml#:~:text=No%20,toscano)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a neighborly approach – perhaps via a friendly long-time resident – to welcome him and reassure that the project will respect the area’s rural character.

neighbors.name: Allan L. Tillapaugh
neighbors.claims: Allan L. Tillapaugh belongs to a fourth-generation dairy farming family in Schoharie County ([www.nysenate.gov](https://www.nysenate.gov/newsroom/in-the-news/2009/james-l-seward/seward-speaks-out-dairy-farmers#:~:text=Susan%20Tillapaugh%20of%20Carlisle%2C%20married,are%20near%20the%20tipping%20point)). His family operates a local dairy business (CDS Tillapaugh LLC) in Cobleskill, focused on dairy cattle and milk production ([naicslist.com](https://naicslist.com/company-profile/cds-tillapaugh-llc-carlisle-ny-12031#:~:text=New%20York%20Company%20in%20the,Cattle%20and%20Milk%20Production%20Sector)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through agricultural community channels – for example, have a fellow farmer or farm bureau member start the conversation – and highlight how the development can align with and even support long-term farm viability.

neighbors.name: Jeffrey R. Hicks
neighbors.claims: No significant public information is available on Jeffrey R. Hicks; his name does not surface in local news or public meeting archives ([www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov](https://www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov/EdocWebApp/faces/VillCob/index.xhtml#:~:text=No%20,hicks)). Hicks owns property in Cobleskill but holds no known civic positions and has made no public statements on community issues ([www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov](https://www2.schohariecounty-ny.gov/EdocWebApp/faces/VillCob/index.xhtml#:~:text=No%20,hicks)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Provide him with project information and an invitation to discuss any questions or concerns, as an open, proactive gesture given his lack of public stance.
